headline: Artichoke Spinach Dip
description: Spinach and artichokes swim in a dish of creamy, cheesy delights.
name: Artichoke Spinach Dip
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, partially thawed
1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the spinach and artichoke hearts. Cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Mix cream cheese and sour cream into the spinach mixture. Stir in Parmesan cheese and garlic salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until thickened, 10 to 15 minutes. Serve warm.

review.reviewBody: Not my favorite recipe. So many of the comments make suggestions about how to modify the original. I tried some of them (doubling the spinach, adding some garlic and spices, etc.) and it just didn’t turn out great. It’ll get eaten, but I won’t serve this batch to guests.
on the second go, i ditched the mayo for ricotta, (as opposed to cream cheese, its ready to mix before we heat it in the 2 qt crockpot), and my supermarket sells spinach in a 16oz pack,

Excellent! I made 1/2 a recipe using 1/2 a bag of spinach, a small jar of marinated artichokes, a clove of minced garlic, onion powder, a 1/2 c of Parmesan cheese, 1/4 c butter, 16 oz of sour cream and a 8 oz block of cream cheese. It makes a lot so 1/2 a recipe was more than enough for us!!!
good stuff
This is a good artichoke and spinach dip recipe but the description says it swims is sauce and it does. Way to thin for me. I ended up doubling the spinach and artichokes.

Sooooo good. I did half the recipe and it was A LOT!! I did 5 oz of organic raw spinach, 1 crushed garlic clove, added 1 organic diced tomato at end of cooking and followed the rest of the recipe as is.
The proportions on this recipe are all over the place so just make it to your liking. I used only one package of sour cream and cream cheese. I would also add a bit more spinach and maybe artichoke.
Made as is, though did half the recipe as it was plenty. Very yummy

I made this for my family on a stay at home movie night. I was excited to make this because I have yet to find a recipe that taste as good as the ones served in restaurants. I followed the recipe exactly. I did notice that you really have to cook this longer than written due to the overwhelming taste of sour cream. The longer it cooks the more the sour cream, garlic, cream cheese and Parmesan cheese yield together making it just ok enough to eat. My family all said the exact same thing when they tried it, “It’s bland”. The recipe made enough to serve an army. I guess I will keep searching for a good spinach dip recipe. But seriously, thanks for taking the time to post this recipe. It’s people like you that take the time to help others in their pursuit of good cooking.

Can't remember if I commented... Loved this recipe. I used all the butter, but half of the other dairy ingredients with fabulous results! Next time, I will try my adjustments with double the spinach and artichoke. Also, just took some out of the freezer the other day and it freezes very well.
A great appetizer! Guests loved it! Easy too!

this was amazing! I was back an forth with another artichoke spinach dip but chose this one an took suggestions from everyone's reviews. 
I ended up adding 3 garlic cloves to the butter, used 1 pack cream cheese an half a container of sour cream an just added 4 cheese italian blend to it an omg!! i loved it my children even loved it. i suggest for a smaller family maybe use half of what i said as it turned out to be alot! you can also refrigerate for 4 days in fridge. soo good.
One of my most highly requested dishes at parties, pot lucks, and just becauses!
I followed some advice and sautéed 2 T finely chopped onion and 2 cloves of garlic into the butter. Also doubled the artichoke hearts. Makes PLENTY and is delicious!

I made this using the full amount of ingredients. I did add 1-1/2 tsps coarse black bepper as well as this amazing https://www.manitoutrading.com/herbs-spices-3/truffle-parmesan-amp-black-garlic-seasoning?rq=truffle. 

I was NOT disappointed. It's delicious hot AND cold. A nice French baguette and a glass of wine. . . yummy dinner!!
Quick, easy and delicious! I substituted Greek yogurt for the sour cream. Everything else was to the recipe.
Good dip except that I tasted sour cream. To mask that, I added garlic. Yum. Will make again cutting back on the sour cream as some viewers suggested.

I am a spinach and artichoke dip lover and I was on the hunt for a good recipe I can make at home. I have made this twice and I love it - it is very creamy which I was skeptical about but I love it. I use less sour cream (only about 8oz) because I don't really like sour cream. I also add more cheese - I didn't actually measure how much I used but I used a handful of parmesean, romano, and mozzarella cheese. Delicious!!
Amazing dip served hot or cold!

I used this recipe as the basis for the dip, and it turned out rather tasty and satisfying. I know some people follow recipes to the letter, but I always modify recipes to my preferred taste. For example, I sauteed 1 cup fresh, chopped spinach with 1 tbsp minced garlic, 1/4 cup chopped yellow onions, 2 chopped scallions, and 1/2 cup chopped California style marinated artichoke hearts (comes in a jar) in butter for about 8-10 minutes on med/low heat. Then, I added 1 and 1/2 pkgs of softened Neufchâtel cheese, 2 tbsp low-fat Greek yogurt, 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese, and 1 tsp salt. I found it was rather lumpy and thick, so I slowly added 1/2 cup low-fat milk and stirred occasionally for about 15 minutes. I served it warm alongside Milton's multi-grain baked crackers. It was a hit! I plan to use this recipe again and try it with other ingredients like extra cheddar and mozzarella cheeses, jalapenos, black olives, cayenne pepper, and chopped water chestnuts.
A super favorite at my house!
I accidentally used twice as much garlic salt and added a little onion powerd and that did it for me. Turned out perfect!!!

I dont know why anyone would not like this delicious recipe! I cut the cream cheese by using a half a 8oz pack, and 1 whole one, and half the sour cream. I also threw some mozzerella cheese in there while it was cooking, and it was amazing without the sour cream! taste restaurant worthy to me served hot with melted mozzerella on top with some tortilla chips. Everything else I kept the same, and im glad I did because I think it would have been over seasoned any other way. Thank you for my first homemade version of the recipe.
I added two small cans of Ortega chilies and everyone loved it ??
Made it as is, love it!!!

I made this over the weekend and everyone raved about it. so easy to make although I did tweek recipe a bit. Used only 1 Crm Cheez and 1 16oz Sour Cream and added one package 5 chz blend Italian cheese. 

Will be making it again for my upcoming B-Day Party.
I made it exactly as the recipe called for and it was delicious! Rich and creamy. It was a huge hit at our party and there was none left by the end of it!

I have made this twice now. I used fresh garlic sauté in the butter. I followed the recipes the first time and gave dip to any body who like it. I froze two pints and had them a month later and they where great . The second time I was making for 100 people and doubled it. I made three different dips and this was the one that was gone. I don't measure a lot so the amount of spinach and artichoke was like the whole bag and the whole jar. I served with fresh French bread chucks. .

I was so supervised when I tasted this. I made this for someone who wanted this sort of dip, expecting that I wouldn't like this but I tried it and I loved this. I was so supervised because I dislike spinach, sour cream, and artichoke but all of them together(plus some extra seasonings) was terrific
We voted it a solid 4 stars as written. Next time more artichokes and spinach, less sour cream. Flavor was great, after all it says garlic salt to taste! If it's too bland, add a little more!

Took this to a church event and my husband and many others were singing it's praises. I only used 1 sour cream and 1 cream cheese after reading other reviews and the ratio was great!! Going to make it again this weekend for a Super Bowl party!
Already made it twice this holiday season!
Great dip. Agree with the reviewer who said to double up on the artichoke and spinach and reduce the creams. I also added one other ingredient as a topper. Cheddar cheese. Perfecto!

I used the same substitutions as other reviewers and doubled the artichokes and added lemon juice. Other than that I followed the recipe given. I've made this many times and found that using real grated Parmesan makes all the difference in the world! The first time I made it I used the grated Parmesan in the can (like you would put on spaghetti) and it was OK. But the next time I used real grated cheese and it was a thousand times better! It's easy to transfer into a crockpot and take to functions too. It's always a hit and I have had several requests for the recipe. YUM!!
This was a big hit with even the kids! My only regret is not doubling the recipe. I used mozzarella instead of parmigiana and voila! A warm cheesey dip from heaven.
Very easy and Very Tasty!

Good recipe! Very easy to follow. I only made half the recipe so it'll fit in the Little Dipper. It made a little more than the container still:) The cream cheese flavor is strong so I'll use it less next time. And to suit my taste I'll add more artichoke. I did add lemon juice and it gave the tanginess I needed so thank you for the review! I'll make it again??
A little less butter. I will make it again as everyone loved it.
Will add 2 cans of artichoke next time (my families preference). Great recipe overall, and simple to make.

I will definitely be making this again! This was a huge hit with my husband, a cheese fiend. However I do think if sour cream and cream cheese is double there should be at least another half pack of spinach...
Loved this recipe; however there are a ton of people who don't like spinach and/or artichokes so you have to know your audience. They won't even try it.
This recipe was so easy, I'm taking it to my bible study tonight, I just love all recipes, everyone thinks I'm awesome cook ,little do they know I've got my own little secret. Love this recipe!!
My sister and I use ma tree inmates artichoke hearts. Great flavor. We also keep courts in the crock pot so it is hot all the time.
Too cheesy, not a huge fan.
Amazing!! I love this dip. Super easy and delicious. I did everything as stated until serving. Then placed in dish with cheese blend on top to melt for presentation.

I used 24 oz frozen spinach and 2 cans of artichoke hearts. I also added 6 cloves of minced garlic to the butter and cooked a few minutes before adding the spinach and chopped artichoke hearts.Left out the garlic powder. I made this for a pot luck. Even though it made a large amount I can hardly bear to part with it. Wonderful!

This got raves rom my friends and family! I actually halved the recipe and it came out delicious. I like this recipe because it is prepared in a pan on the stovetop. I prepared recipe a little early then just heated when ready to serve. No fuss!

Great recipe with some adjustments for my preferences & tips from other reviewers. I did use half the cream cheese & sour cream with a 16 oz bag frozen spinach and olive oil instead of butter. I added 5 cloves of fresh minced garlic, 1 finely chopped jalapeno (seeds removed) and about 3/4 cup chopped red onion, all of which I sauteed in the olive oil with some thyme, parsley and paprika before adding 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice & artichokes then spinach. The result was outstanding. This dip goes well with pita chips, tortilla chips, crackers, vegetables and who knows what else. Mmm... Yummy!
This dip is delicious
So easy! So good! Huge hit!

I did modify this recipe, but what we ended up with was delicious! My fiance said it tasted like something you would order in a restaurant. I only had half a block of cream cheese, so I scaled down the recipe to reflect that. I didn't have any artichokes on hand, so instead I increased the spinach amount and also added about 2.5 chopped green onions (the remaining part of the onion I sprinkled on top of the pizza we made). As others suggested, I added some garlic in with the butter in the beginning, but I still added in some garlic salt because it's a stronger flavor. Yummy! It turned out cheesy and delicious, and the green onion complemented all the flavors!

I've barely taken this recipe off the stove for the first time, and I'm already reviewing it. It's THAT good! I halved the recipe from the get-go, but used an entire can of artichoke hearts to avoid waste. I also sauteed two cloves worth of minced garlic in the butter before adding the spinach and artichoke mixture, and threw some Worcestershire sauce and a bit of salt in once all the other ingredients were in the saucepan. Be sure to use a larger dish than you think will be necessary for this one; even halved, this recipe yields a fair amount. I have a feeling that my dinner (Marie's Easy Slow Cooker Pot Roast - another good one from this site!) will be spoiled tonight thanks to this recipe.
It was good.

This dip is so delicious! It's great for parties since it makes quite a bit. I melted the butter with fresh garlic (taken from another review) and I baked it in the oven. SUPERB taste & all of it went & I was asked for the recipe!

Perfect dip- although I did make adjustments. I cut the cream cheese and sour cream in half and also used a bit less spinach. Sauteed onions with the butter and also added a bit of lemon juice. So delicious!

I made so many changes I'm tempted to write a new recipe!! I made every change that I read by other reviewers. Half a lemon, black pepper, onions, cut the sour cream in half and doubled the artichokes. What brought this to a new level was when I went across the street to Chipotle to grab some black pepper, I was inspired to grab some of their chipotle tobacco sauce. Unbelievably good. Add the chipotle tabasco sauce and thank me later.

As written, I felt like this was off but with minor modifications, this dip is delicious. IMO it definitely needs double the amount of spinach called for if you plan to use all the cream cheese & sour cream, and fresh garlic, salt, and pepper versus garlic salt is the way to go. About 1C mozzarella cheese is also a nice addition. Add cayenne or hot sauce if you like it spicy. These variations receive rave reviews every time.
We really enjoyed this recipe. Just added the missing fresh garlic and then sauté with the butter. So much better than going out!

Thank you for this recipe! I always loved the richness of spinach dips and wondered how it was made. Following the recommendations of other reviewers:

16 oz bag of chopped spinach
14 oz can artichoke hearts
4-6 cloves minced garlic
Some minced onion
8 oz cream cheese
16 oz sour cream
Dash of Worchestershire sauce
Dash of lemon juice
Dash of pepper flakes, salt, pepper
Parmesean cheese
Mozzarella cheese

It was creamy, full of spinach with a little tang (also helps the absorption of iron). At first, I thought it would be too much spinach and artichoke but it cooks down nicely. Makes a big pot so there will be some leftovers. I think it must be healthy!

This is a fantastic recipe! Everyone always loves it at parties. I saute some minced garlic in the butter before the veggies because we love garlic, and I halve the cream cheese, sour cream and parmesan - we love the taste but frankly it makes too much and this way we have twice the veggies in the dip!

One word.... AWFUL. We started with going by the book.. When we wanted to spit it out immediately we added veggie soup mix, roasted red peppers, garlic, lemon juice and now we are desperately searching the cabinets for something else. It's getting better but its not something I want to eat. So disappointed.

I followed the recipe except I used 12 oz can artichoke hearts, 1 (8 oz) cream cheese softened, 1 (16 oz) sour cream. I would use less sour cream next time b/c it tasted too much like sour cream. It did LACK A LOT of flavor if you follow recipe as is. I sauteed 3 diced garlic cloves, added pepper & garlic salt, and it still was missing something! I decided to put a few drops of lemon juice like others have suggested and that really helped it. I think PESTO is what this recipe needed! I added a tablespoon. All these flavors came together nicely and everyone loved it at the party. Fed 20 people.

This recipe is wonderful. I made it for a party and it was a big hit. I altered the recipe by using 2 ounces of butter (half the recommended amount) adding 1/4 tsp Mrs. Dash and a dash of black pepper.

I thought this recipe was good. I'm not a huge fan of dips with cream cheese and sour cream bc of the fat content, but I was in a pinch and needed something fast. I took some of the suggestions of the other reviewers cut the recipe in half. Even half recipe makes a very large portion (enough for a group of 10 I'd say). I also sautéed garlic in the butter, added lemon juice, kosher salt. I added a couple splats of Tabasco, which didn't really add much to the flavor. It could have used more if you wanted a little more zing. I recommend skipping the Worchestershire sauce that another reviewer suggested. The flavor didn't really mesh with the other flavors well. Overall, it was easy to prepare, keeps well in the fridge and reheats easily.
Everyone at Easter dinner loved it. Followed all directions except added an extra thing of spinach. Was perfect amount of spinach. Will definitely make again. Super easy and fast to make.

We loved this! Used 2 pkg cream cheese, 1 16 oz ctn sour cream, 1 pkg frozen spinach, 2 cans of artichokes. Sauteed some onion and garlic on stove first before adding spinach and artichokes, and did not use the garlic salt. Very yummy, even spread some leftovers on pizza crust later on and it was really good that way. Could probably bake it if you wanted to.

This recipe is very basic- I wouldn't call it bland, but it is certainly missing something. Next time I will use less sour cream and more cream cheese, not to mention all the add-ins that others have mentioned- onion, fresh garlic, ect.

I hate to leave a review when I've changed ingredients/amts, but this was a fantastic recipe so I felt like I needed to! I halved the cream cheese and sour cream, sauteed one garlic clove with the spinach, and left out the artichokes (didn't have any). My whole family loved it - it tasted very similar (only better!) to a frozen TGIF version that we get at the grocery store. The best part is that it was made with ingredients that I always have on hand so it can be made on the fly for unexpected company.
amazing! once when I made it we didnt have the perfect amount of everything, but it i such a good combo of ingredients it still tasted amazing.

This dip is fantastic! And definitely the best spinach/artichoke dip that I have ever made. I cut the recipe in half, which worked out perfectly. I noticed that some reviewers said that it was a little too cream cheese-y, and for me it seemed like the cream cheese clumped up just a little bit and that's when it tasted too much like cream cheese. Maybe I should have let the cream cheese melt just a little bit more. It was still great though. Thanks for the recipe!
Yum! I didn't want it to be too "cheesy" so I only used one cream cheese and one 16oz sour cream. Turned out great!
Yummy-doo! I added an extra container of spinach and it was perfect.
I give this 5 stars, I followed the recipe to the T and everyone loved it. I made it again and tripled the recipe.

One word, EXCELLENT. Just as good if not better than the dips that the restaurants serve. I followed the advice of the other reviewer, decreased the cream cheese, sour cream, but increased the artichokes and spinach, and sautéed the garlic. It was a huge hit for out football playoff party!

The recipe was great but I thought it had to much of a cream cheese flavor once it was done, I mixed in some home made salsa and it cut down on that flavor and tasted great. Next time I will just cut down on the cream cheese some.

I followed the suggestions of other reviewers and only used 8 oz. of cream cheese and 16 oz. of sour cream. I also used Romano and Parmesan cheeses in equal parts, about 1/2 c. of each. Everyone ate the dip and complimented me on it, but I am giving it 4 stars because although it was good, I have had far better Spinach Artichoke dips.
This is an easy EXCEPTIONAL recipe! It taste a lot like what you get at the Olive Garden only you can season it to your liking. Absolutely I must for any entertaining event!

Awesome tasting spinach-artichoke dip! I took the advice of other reviewers added some garlic cloves and sauteed with the butter. I only used 1 pkg of cream cheese and 1 pint of sour cream. I like to taste the spinach and artichoke, and would like to try adding an extra can of artichoke next time. Filled my 1.5 qt corningware perfectly, even with the reduced cream cheese and sour cream.
I used only 1 brick of cream cheese and 1 (16 oz) container of cream cheese. I also added fresh garlic to the melted butter. Best spinach dip I ever had!!
Excellent recipe! Agree with adding lemon juice... I also added fresh garlic and mozerella to complete this recipe....yum!
I followed the recipe exactly and it was missing something, it was very bland

Very good! Unless you like a mostly cheesy dip with little veggies in it, I highly recommend either doubling the spinach/artichokes, or halving the sour cream/cream cheese. I halve the sour cream and cream cheese, and it always makes LOTS, with just enough spinach and artichokes on each bite. I like to scoop it into a baking dish and melt some cheese on the top in the oven as well. Always a hit where ever I bring it.

Followed advice of others and added garlic to butter and doubles the spinach/artichokes. Also added some pimento cheese. I poured it into a over-safe dish and reheated at 350 for 10 minutes at a friend's house. It was a HIT!
I use a combination of two of these recipes to make my dip & it's a hit.
Really delicious but the quantity is just unnecessary unless you're feeding a crowd of 30 or more.
this was an excellent recipe. i used fresh ingredients which took a little more time but it came out great. will definately use this again.

This was a great recipe to start with. I used a lot of suggestions from others and put my own twist on it. I did roast garlic, then saute it in the butter. I added the artichokes and lemon juice to that, then put that in the slow cooker with 16 oz. of cream cheese (fat free). I used 16 oz. of spinach instead of 10, and 1 container of sour cream, but later added a little mayo and Lactaid. After heating thoroughly I added a little more lemon juice, chili powder and paprika (just a sprinkle!), and 21-spice salute from Trader Joe's. 

It only took 6 people to kill the crock pot-full, and they couldn't stop talking about how great it was! (Four of the people are into Spin-Art dip in a big way, two are foodies - I couldn't stop patting myself on the back :))
Good recipe! i sauteed the garlic with the butter. i cut down on the cream cheese and shour cream as per other reviews. will be making it again!
This was really good but, I modified it pretty heavily. I halved the sour cream and cream cheese and added heafty portions of Romano and Asiago cheeses.

Like the other reviews I only used one package of cream cheese and only one package of sour cream and it's perfect! It still comes out very creamy and cheesy but with more spinach and artichoke flavor (also a more manageable amount). Although be warned that the recipe still makes quite a bit. It was a great hit with the family on xmas.
i made this for thanksgiving dinner. everyone enjoyed it.
Love, love, love!
Great recipe but need to cut ingredients in half.
great recipe.. just added 2 cans of artichokes and one cream cheese and 2 tablespoons of minced garlic... yummmy
Excellent! I often half it because it makes an incredible amount!
This is such a wonderful and easy dip to prepare! Followed recipe exactly and everyone gobbled it up.
This is such a wonderful and easy dip to prepare! Followed recipe exactly and everyone gobbled it up.
This was really great! I might cut down on the cream cheese the next time, but really enjoyed it!
Everyone goes nuts when I make this! So yummy with tortilla chips or toasted bread.
